circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Tevanian was last seen at her home in Portland, Maine on March 17, 1996. Sometime during the early morning hours of St. Patrick's Day, Margaret Tevanian slipped out of her Portland home in her pajamas and robe. She took little with her - just a paper bag containing her toothbrush, toothpaste and dental floss.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: paper bag containing her toothbrush, toothpaste and dental floss

Pajamas and robe; wearing a blue kerchief
on her head.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Jesse Hoover was last seen on May 20, 1983 at the Baxter State Park Headquarters. Hoover traveled to Maine from Texas to hike the Appalachian Trail. She had no special equipment or knowledge to aid her while hiking. Jesse was reported missing on July 11, 1983 by her sister.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Jesse was carrying a blue knapsack when she was last seen.
Jesse was last seen wearing blue jeans, a blue shirt, and a blue windbreaker.

images.caption: Picture taken from Maine State Police website.  Cropped and enhanced by RSS Flanagan on 11/21/2011.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Oliveras was last seen at the Platinum Plus Club in Portland. A resident of the Hyde Park section of Boston, he traveled to Maine two days before by bus to visit a friend who worked at the club. He was scheduled to return that day to the home he shared with his mother and younger brother. Just before he went missing, he was seen in the clubâ€™s parking lot with an unidentified man.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Miguel was last seen wearing dark-green cargo shorts and a gray-and-white camouflage shirt over a long-sleeved white shirt.
Miguel was last seen wearing sneakers.

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: Miguel's hair has also been described as black.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Miguel has tattoos on the back of his neck,left arm, and right hand and on his back.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Ayla was last seen at home on December 16, 2011.  Her left arm is in a sling. Ayla was last seen wearing green pajamas with polka-dots and "Daddy's Princess" written on the front.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Green one-piece pajamas that have polka dots and reads "Daddy's Princess" on the front

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Bernard Ross was a resident of Fort Kent when he was last seen on May 12, 1977. Ross was suspected of stealing a vehicle from Presque Isle. He was last seen on the Realty Road near the Ashland-Portage Town line. Despite numerous searches he was never located.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: green down vest over gold chamois shirt, brown corduroy jeans

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Scar on abdomen, small chicken pox marks on top of nose

images.caption: Bernard's photo is shown age-progressed to 58 years (05/26/2017)

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Per law enforcement - Roger was last seen at his residence in Porter making comments that he wanted to go to the Fryeburg Fair.  Roger was never seen or heard from again.  It is unclear if he made it to the fair.

Marilyn's husband moved away and indicated that she told him she was going to a Catholic retreat in the Montana area.  Marilyn has not been heard from since.
Lawrence went missing in early November 2004 from the southern Kennebec area.  He was reported missing by SSI staff when Larry failed to pick up his monthly benefits for November 2004.

Burnett was last seen on February 21, leaving a residence on Eastbrook Road in Franklin.  The morning Burnett went missing, his dog, Bev, also went missing but Bev returned home two weeks later.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Last seen on fishing vessel "Miss Anne" leaving Eastport to go scallop dragging.  Boat was reported missing when they did not arrive in Stockton Springs as planned. Intense USCG search only found a skiff belonging to the fishing vessel.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Plaid flannel shirt, charcoal gray jacket, blue jeans

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: The boat left Hancock Pt. about 2pm on Thursday afternoon with 6 people aboard to go clamming on Stave Island.  They clammed that tide and started from Stave Island back to Hancock Pt. with 12 bushels of clams and 6 people.  Apparently the motor got snarled up in a rope from an old lobster trap and stopped.  The wake of the boat came over the stern of the boat and filled it causing the boat to upset throwing all of the people into the ocean.

Michael Percy and Judd Miller (MP # 42084) were on their way back from Stockton Springs in a lobster boat Miller had just bought. The boat was found anchored off Turtle Head, Isle Au Haut Island. Michael could not swim.

publicGeolocation.formattedAddress: Tenants Harbor, St George, ME 04860, USA

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Henry was a passenger in a small charted flight that was going from Portsmouth, NH to Nova Scotia. The engine stalled and the plane crashed into the ocean off Kennebunkport, Maine.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: He was picking up a new Citabria aircraft from Connecticut to deliver to Lisair (his employer) in Houlton, Maine. The Augusta VOR was out of service and as he attempted to switch to it from the Kennebunk VOR, he became lost in a storm. He placed a mayday call that was picked up by the Portland, Maine airport at 1207 hours which was the last contact with him. It is believed his plane may have crashed in Southwestern Maine or Eastern New Hampshire in poor weather.

vehicles.comment: Hogan was piloting a Citabria single engine aircraft, white and yellow in color.  The aircraft was brand new purchased by LISAir of Houlton, ME.

images.caption: NOT actual plane, but same Make and Model Hogan was believed to be piloting at the time of his disappearance.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Allegedly went to Florida to make money to fix up his boat. Last seen alive in March 2017 and no contact has been made with anyone since then.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Black jeans, flannel shirt and black t-shirt

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Ronald was depressed and facing financial issues. He had spoken of jumping off the Penobscot Narrows Bridge before and the car he was borrowing was found at the bridge. All his belongings were inside and there was a note indicating he may have harmed himself.
Cynthia dropped her son at school and was never seen again. There is suspicion that Cynthia walked out into the river and intentionally drowned herself.

Doug, his wife and two friends were flying in a chartered private plane from Stonington to Pittsfield. The plane crashed into the Penobscot Bay. Two people were recovered, Doug and his wife Beryl (MP53572) were not recovered.
Harold lived alone and was known to be getting more forgetful. He left all the lights on in the house, and his car in the driveway. It's believed he wandered off.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Key ring with "a lot of keys"

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Peter was visiting his hunting cabin on Tunk Lake alone. He loaded up a canoe with hunting supplies. The canoe and supplies were found floating in the lake, Peter was never seen again.

Joseph Jones and his crew were aboard his fishing vessel, the Bottom Basher, headed out to drag for sea urchins. The boat and crew were last seen by a passing fisherman near Falls Island, in the Cobscook Bay. The body of a crew member was recovered the next day. Many pieces of the boat have been recovered.
Departed Friendship to go kayaking for a couple days. Kayak located overturned on 07/22/2019 near Allen Island.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Khaki cotton shorts, button down cotton shirt, white socks

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Scars on legs from chainsaw accident

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: John was living at 25 Victory Lane, Parsonsfield by himself.  A neighbor saw John on July 21, 2003 driving by his house, leaving Victory Lane in the morning.  John's house was destroyed by fire on Thursday July 24, 2003.  This was a camp style small home with no power or running water.  John's dog was found in good health wandering around the area of the residence and John's vehicle, a 1992 Ford Explorer was destroyed in the fire as well.  The Fire Marshal's Office found no sign of John's remains at the residence.  An extensive search was done by the Warden Service in the following days.  John has not been located.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Last see on 05/25/1987 and reported missing to PD in 1988. Circumstances unknown at this time.

On 06/13/1970 Kenneth who was a lobster fisherman had gone out fishing from Owls Head, Maine. His watercraft was later found abandoned on a tiny rock island (Marblehead Island) at the mouth of Penobscot Bay. Searches of the area were unsuccessful in finding Mr. Stone.
Mr. Cluff was last known to have gone lobstering at approximately 10:00am in a 12" aluminum skiff. Mr. Cluff was believed to have launched his craft at Turbat's Creek.

She was last seen in the downtown area of Portland, Maine.  At the time of disappearance, Cathy was said to have had 4 first bicuspid teeth removed and braces put on her teeth, but no verification of the extractions.  She wore thick eyeglasses.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Cathy was last seen wearing a navy blue coat and navy blue dress pants.
Cathy was last seen wearing eyeglasses with dark, thick rims.
Cathy was last seen wearing brown leather shoes.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Investigation shows that Vining last worked at Smythe's IGA in Presque Isle and that she last appeared for work there in October 1998. In 2012 a man was convicted for her murder. The Maine Supreme Court upheld this ruling in 2015. Her remains were never found but believe to have been incinerated.

Reeves K. Johnson went missing from Kittery sometime between 4 February 1983 and 21 February 1983. The exact details of his case are hard to pin down as witnesses reported seeing him but often could not say for sure what the dates were. Reeves car was towed into the Elwin Park Exxon in Portsmouth, NH for repairs, the mechanic on duty identified Reeves from a photo and said that Reeves wanted “quick” repairs because he was heading south.

Price's grandmother called and reported that Price had tried to kill himself.  She reported that she took the firearm from him and he fled into the woods.  A police canine track was conducted that led to Rte. 9 in Eddington where a boot print was observed.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: scar on chest

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: While investigating a separate missing person's report based out of Canaan, Maine, (Cheryl Murdoch) it was learned that Murdoch was a victim of a homicide.  Murdoch's body had been located in the woods in Canaan, Maine, in close proximity to the residence of Shannon Atwood and Shirley Atwood, which was located on the Hartland Road.  Shannon Atwood was subsequently arrested and convicted for the murder of Cheryl Murdoch.  During the early stages of the investigation into the Murdoch homicide, neighbors and family members expressed concerns on the whereabouts of Shirley Atwood, who normally was found to be at home with her husband, Shannon Atwood.  Shannon Atwood was indicted for her murder even though her body was not found.  The Shirley Atwood murder indictment was later dismissed without prejudice by the Maine AG's Office.  Shirley Atwood's body has not been located.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Subject was reported to be having marital and financial problems.  He was being investigated by the local DA for theft, by the AG's Office for Bar Association complaints and had been borrowing large amounts of money and passing bad checks with overdrawn accounts.  The IRS was investigating him for tax evasion.  Joseph had recently become despondent and making suicidal threats.  He may have gone to the local DA during the weekend of his disappearance.

Derek was last seen on 11/13/15 in Carmel Maine. He had quit his job and texted a family member as to where to locate his truck. His vehicle was located at the Walmart parking lot in Palmyra, Maine on 11/17/15. Derek was seen on surveillance video parking his truck and walking toward route 2. He has not been seen or heard from since.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: On the morning of November 25th, 1975 Belanger went deer hunting with his wife and brother off of Route 206 in Washington.  The three had originally separated and then met up with each other a short while later.  Belanger decided to continue to hunt while his brother and Linda returned home sometime around 9:00am that morning.  When they left him, Belanger was last seen walking across a field into the woods off of Route 105 with his hunting rifle.  Belanger was never seen again.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Dupuis suffered from alcoholism.  A friend last saw him on 12/3/1995. He was last believed to have been at Bob's Exxon on 12/4/16 when he bought a pint of alcohol.  He bought a month membership at a local tanning salon shortly afterwards.  He would often drink by the river's edge and would use the bridge spanning the river to cross between both Biddeford and Saco.

XL Mexican blanket jacket
Black horn on gold chain, silver arrowhead on black rawhide, silver/black eagle on black rawhide

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Raymond was last known to be fishing from his boat "JOSHUA'S DELIGHT."  Anecdotal information suggests that he was fishing about 25 miles off the coast in a location called Schoodic Ledges for haddock, cod and flounder; that the had radio contact with other fishermen about heading to port due to an incoming storm; that other fishermen came to port while Raymond reportedly was going to return to port when he was finished with his "tow"; that he never made it to port and a search ensued.  It was reported that a life boat was found and had not been used as well as a possible oil slick.  It is unknown exactly where these were found.  Raymond was alone on this day.  Raymond was known to wear orange or yellow "oil skins" while fishing and regular clothes when heading to or from the fishing grounds.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Unknown sizes.  He would wear orange or yellow oil skins (rain gear) while fishing and regular clothes when not fishing.

vehicles.comment: Used a 38 or 40 foot "Duffy" fishing vessel named "JOSHUA's DELIGHT"

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Reportedly had skin and flesh missing from one or two fingers due to getting the caught in rope while fishing.  Possibly his index and middle fingers of either hand.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
On  10/27/2008 Chris went out lobster fishing in his open hull 21 foot  boat from Matinicus Island in the Penobscot Bay. On that day around 2pm  a fellow fisherman called his father and asked him to come down to the dock to look at some items he had found in the water. The father recognized those items as belonging to Chris. 

Numerous groups were involved in a search for him but Chris, nor his boat, were ever located.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Darin and his brother Kevin left out of New Harbor aboard a boat, the North Wind, a stern dragger. They left on September 6, 1990 to go on a 4-5 day fishing trip. Contact attempts were made on September 7th and September 9th with negative results. On September 10th another vessel noticed a large fuel spill on the water, the next day this vessel pulled up a body. This was identified at Kevin Crocker. Circumstances indicate the boat sank of unknown reasons on September 7, 1990.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Stephen Thompson worked as a manager at Schwan's in Oakland. On the morning of June 2, 1986, Stephen was dropped off at work by his wife. That morning employees observed Stephen at work. Later that morning unsuccessful attempts were made to make contact/locate Stephen. The Oakland Police Department responded and investigated. circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: John Malloch was blind as a result of injuries suffered in World War II.  He was staying with an acquaintance at a residence in Waterville and left to get some air on the evening of 9/26/65 and was never seen again.  Searches were conducted for Malloch on 9/27/65 and again in spring of 1966, however he was never located.  Malloch was declared dead in 1972 so his estate could be settled.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Thomas left his home in South Londonderry Township in Pennsylvania with no specific destination. His car was found in northern Piscataquis County in September 1991. His bicycle was found a mile north of Millinocket Lake in November 1992.
Ronald was in his boat, hauling back lobster traps when he sank. The boat was recovered from the ocean floor.

Thomas was last seen by commercial lobster fisherman (captain) Christopher Hutchinson aboard lobster fishing vessel "No Limits." The fishing vessel sunk during an offshore winter storm approximately 12 miles south west of Matinicus Island.  Thomas and another crew member, Tyler Sawyer (MP # 42790) aboard the fishing vessel were not able to use emergency survival suits or life raft.  Christopher Hutchinson was rescued in the vessels life raft by a United States Coast Guard helicopter.  Further search did not result in the location or recovery of remaining crew.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Jason Reil is a vulnerable missing adult in need of his medication.  He went missing from his apartment in Brunswick, Maine and was last seen on January 12, 2012  He left behind his cell phone, glasses and keys and believed to have taken his wallet. Jason stopped taking needed medication and may exhibit agitation, pacing, mumbling and anxiety.  He is of no threat to anyone, however, his condition makes him vulnerable and at-risk.  Jason is more than probably in shelters or living on the street or possibly with an unknown person for shelter.  It was found that he used his debit card at a Rite Aid Store in Brunswick, Maine on January 18, 2012 so it is believed that he is still in the area. Jason is an excellent artist and poet.  His family is extremely worried and ask the public to please help look for Jason.

She was wearing a white blouse, blue jeans, white high-top sneakers, and a men's class ring engraved "Mike 87" and "Mike Staples."  She also has a surgical scar on her back.  FOUL PLAY IS SUSPECTED.
